Key Arguments: The bill will significantly impact the ability to perform professional duties and affect human rights in a democratic nation.
The bill infringes on the implied right of political speech and freedom of speech, which are foundational to democracy.
Censorship resulting from the bill will stifle scientific debate, questioning, and challenging the status quo.
The bill is seen as a pathway to totalitarianism and is compared to censorship condemned by the United States.
Censorship will lead to a lack of political diversity and creativity, pushing the country towards communism and tyranny.
The bill assumes people cannot think critically or research for themselves, leading to fear of speaking up.
Notable Quotes: This Bill aims to crush freedom of speech.
A censoring Government is no longer acting in a democratic way.
Censorship is about silencing our voices, dissent and political diversity.
A Democratic Government should be supporting the freedom of an individual to articulate their ideas and opinions.
